column5: Hi Guys. I have a small trailer that came with a Hobiecat sailboat. Not using it. Thought I could use it to trailer the ATV. Would this be legal to convert using plywood and 2x4s  and u-clamp everything to the frame. Homemade ?
is it plated now as a legal trailer
Yes, just make sure it's not one of "those" trailers that MTO looks for, you know, gun tape, baler twine and bubble gum holding things together.

When I picked the used sailboat/trailer up, it had no plates.  Drove it home anyway. It's a Proper galvanized boat trailer with lights. So if I make a well built platform on it and get plates it would be legal on the roads? I guess it should say on it "max weight" somewhere.

Did you get a bill of sale?  Somewhere on the tongue it should have the VIN and capacities.  Either shorten the tongue and call it a home made trailer and register it as such.  You may have to get it inspected.
I just registered my homebuilt double axle boat trailer, in and out of the mto in ten min. with plates and ownership no inspection required.
